content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the string
    lowered_col = lowercase(col)

    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    stripped_col = strip(lowered_col)

    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    cleaned_col = replace(stripped_col, r"[\s-]+" => "_")

    return cleaned_col
end
```

You can use this function to clean any column name as follows:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("Another-Column-Name")
"another_column_name"
```

This function works by first lowercasing the input string, then removing any leading or trailing whitespaces, and finally replacing any remaining spaces or hyphens with an underscore. It uses Julia's built-in functions `lowercase`, `strip`, and `replace`, as well as a regular expression to match one or more spaces or hyphens.
